result.execSummary:
The defendant Pamela S Windom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
--The Court orders Ms. Windom to pay restitution in the amount of $110 to Greg Adler, this is to be converted to a civil judgment

--Per Standing Order Defendant to pay 5% & 10% restitution surcharge

--to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge=$443, to be paid in $30 per month installments commencing on 3/21/16 and on the 21st day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a  9 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

--Per Standing Order Defendant to pay $10 Drug Offender Diversion Surcharge

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Pamela S Windom

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: per JCSD Defendant paid the fine // Duplicate original warrant document returned from JCSD
RN mailed to Defendant - Unable to Fwd
RN mailed to Defendant - Unable to Fwd.

[MK] case called at 1:27pm. 
Defendant Pamela S Windom in court.  
Ms. Windom indicates that she has been given notice that a back-payment for benefits for her child will be paid on approximately 10/4/16.  Ms. Windom indicates that she can make a $200 payment in this case once she receives that benefit-payment.  
The Court revises Ms. Windom's payment plan to require that Ms. Windom make a $200 payment on 10/14/16; thereafter she is required to make $30 per month payments commencing on 11/14/16 and on the 14th day of each month thereafter until paid in full. 
[Clerk's added note:  the clerk gives Ms. Windom a new "Time to Pay" slip, designating that the previously ordered alternate sentence of 9 days  Jail applies if there is non-payment.] 
recess 1:31pm.
Payment hearing on September 26, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Payment Plan Summary mailed to Defendant - Unable to Fwd
6/24/16: Court suspends pay plan and it will commence again begining on 7/16/16.
from Defendant requesting an extension on her payment plan
Court grants an extension of time to pay until 4 pm on March 29, 2016. cc: all, Bookkeeping & Jefferson County Clerk of Court
From Defendant requesting an extension of the start date of payment plan
Sent to Defendant (1)Notice of Entry of Judgment (2)JOC w/Standing Orders (3)Payment Plan Summary w/TTP slip//sent to LKA

Case called at 11:49am [mo]
Defendant Pamela S Windom in court, in custody with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Ms. Windom

The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 10 days in Jefferson County Jail, WITHOUT Huber privileges; to commence FORTHWITH
--The Court orders Ms. Windom to pay restitution in the amount of $110 to Greg Adler, this is to be converted to a civil judgement
--to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge=$443, to be paid in $30 per month installments commencing on 3/21/16 and on the 21st day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a   9 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

Days credit for time already served:  5  days
recess: 12:15pm
Duplicate Warrant Original received from JCSD - Defendant is in custody
The Court issues a bench warrant, shall Ms. Windom be taken into custody she may be released upon posting $500 CASH bail, so long as a new hearing date and time are given

Case called at 10:13am [mo]
Defendant Pamela S Windom not in court.   ADA Jeffrey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

recess: 10:16am--reconvene:10:20am ((to allow the Clerk to locate Atty. De La Rosa))

Atty. De La Rosa now appears; all other appearances remain the same
The Court reviews the Court Record, including Returned Mail.
The Court issues a bench warrant, shall Ms. Windom be taken into custody she may be released upon posting $500 CASH bail, so long as a new hearing date and time are given. 
The Court finds bond to be in default and orders the bond to be forfeit.
recess: 10:22am
Sent to Defendant (1) NOH for 12/8/15 STC//sent to LKA; envelople marked 'return to sender, HML did not pick up"
Defendant made voluntary appearance//Duplicate Original Warrant returned from JCSD

[MK] case called at 11:19am. 
Defendant Pamela S Windom in court with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA John Fryatt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court quashes the Warrant. 
The Court reinstates the Signature Bond. 
recess 11:21am. 


NEXT:  Status Conference on 12/8/15 at 10:00am

Case called at 9:44am [mo]
Defendant Pamela S Windom does NOT appear in court
Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa appears in court.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. De La Rosa indicates that Ms. Windom's transportation for todays hearing failed to pick her up.
ADA Hall requests a bench warrant and bond to be forfeit.

The Court issues a bench warrant, Ms. Windom may post $500 CASH to be released so long as the new bond includes a new hearing date and time.
The Court finds bond to be in default and orders the bond to be forfeited.
recess: 9:47am
Defendant appeared in-custody//Duplicate Original Warrant returned from JCSD

Case called at 1:20 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Pamela S Windom appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that Miss Windom is eligible for SPD Services

Service of Complaint admitted; DOB confirmed accurate & new address given; reading waived.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court requires a $1000 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence
-No possession of dangerous weapons as defined by statute
-No contact with Greg Adler or presence at his residence
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
Recess: 1:23 pm 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 8/26/15 at 10:20 am - Send notices  (2) STC scheduled for 9/29/15 at 8:30 am - Send notices

Prior: 1162 Moorland Rd., Apt 109, Madison, WI 53713
